news.title: At Trump's $148 million meme coin dinner, 'the food sucked' and security was lax, attendee says
news.summary: Trump's meme coin dropped 16% the morning after a black-tie gala for buyers. Political backlash that threatens to derail stablecoin legislation.

news.title: Starmer has delivered some key wins for the UK recently, so why is he so unpopular?
news.summary: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer has achieved some major economic wins for the U.K., but his popularity is at a record low.

news.title: Companies turn to AI to navigate Trump tariff turbulence
news.summary: Businesses are turning to artificial intelligence tools ranging from intelligent agents to predictive systems that can simulate changes in U.S. tariff policies. Businesses are Turning to Artificial Intelligence Tools ranging from Intelligent Agents to Predictive Systems.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts favor these stocks for the long haul
news.summary: Here are three stocks favored by the Street's top pros, according to TipRanks. The stocks are Apple, Facebook and Microsoft. The stock market is down about 2% this year.

news.title: Trump threatens Apple with 25% tariff: Is now a good time to buy an iPhone?
news.summary: President Donald Trump threatened Apple with 25% tariffs on any iPhone sold, but not made, in the U.S. On Friday, Apple announced it would be launching a new iPhone 5S and 5C.

news.title: My daughter’s boyfriend, a guest in my home, offered to powerwash part of my house — then demanded money
news.summary: “The amount was about what I would have paid to get the whole house done, and not just one side,’ he said.

news.summary: President Trump has threatened new E.U. and smartphone tariffs. The spotlight is back on U.S. supply chains after the threat.

news.title: Why this stock-market strategist expects no recession and zero rate cuts in 2025
news.summary: Keith McCullough: U.S. bond market and currency are both going up. He says the two primary factors that lead him to make decisions in the bond market are both up. McCullough says he will make a decision on the dollar in coming days.
